author: Special Correspondent
text:
Victims were waiting to cross the road

Three college students had a narrow escape, suffering minor injuries, after being knocked down by a mini bus near NES junction in Yelahanka on Saturday morning. The police said that the victims — Lalitha, K.P. Yashodha and Chandrakala — are students of Government College in Yelahanka. The three girls were waiting near NES Junction to cross the road when a mini bus attached to R.L. Jallappa College in Doddaballapur hit them. The victims were rushed to a nearby private hospital by passersby. The passersby also informed the police about the incident after getting the girls to safety. The doctors said that Yashodha’s right leg was fractured due to the accident. The bus driver abandoned the vehicle and fled from the spot.
title: Bus knocks down three students
